prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A00XX Matriisilaskenta, MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A00XX Matrisräkning, MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A00XX Matrix algebra, MS-A01XX Differential- and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa laskea approksimaatioita osittaisderivaattojen avulla
- osaa ratkaista yhtälöryhmiä Newtonin menetelmällä
- tuntee ja ymmärtää optimoinnin perusideoita
- osaa käyttää Lagrangen kertoimia
- osaa laskea taso- ja avaruusintegraaleja
- osaa vaihtaa integroimisjärjestyksen tasointegraalissa
- osaa vaihtaa muuttujia taso- ja avaruusintegraalissa
learningOutcomes.sv: - kunna räkna approximationer med hjälp av partiella derivator - kunna lösa ekvationssystem med Newtons metod - känna till och förstår optimeringens grundidéer - kunna använda Lagrange multiplikatorer - kunna räkna dubbel- och trippelintegraler - kunna byta integrationsordning i dubbelintegraler - kunna byta variabler i dubbel- och trippelintegraler
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will - know how to calculate approximations with the aid of partial derivatives - be able to solve systems of equations with Newton's method - know and understand the basic ideas of optimization - be able to use Lagrange multipliers - be able to calculate double and triple integrals - be able to change the order of integration in double integrals - know how to change variables in double and triple integrals

content.fi: usean muuttujan funktiot ja niiden derivaatat, usean muuttujan funktion optimointi, taso- ja avaruusintegraalit.
content.sv: funktioner av flera variabler och deras derivator, optimering av funktioner med flera variabler, dubbel- och trippelintegraler.
content.en: functions of several variables and their derivatives, optimization of functions with several variables, double and triple integrals.

assesmentMethods.fi: luennot, harjoitukset ja kurssitentti TAI tentti
assesmentMethods.sv: föreläsningar, övningar och kurstentamen ELLER tentamen
assesmentMethods.en: lectures, exercises and course exam OR exam only

substitutes.fi: Yhdessä kurssin MS-A03XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 3 kanssa korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Yhdessä joko kurssin MS-A04XX Diskreetin matematiikan perusteet tai kurssin MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1 kanssa korvaa kurssin Mat-1.1120. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2.
substitutes.sv: Tillsammans med kursen MS-A03XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 3 ersätter kurser Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Tillsammans med kursen MS-04XX Grundkurs i diskret matematik eller kursen MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1 ersätter kursen Mat-1.1120. Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2.
substitutes.en: Together with the course MS-A03XX Differential and integral calculus 3 substitutes the courses Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Together with the course MS-A04XX Foundations of discrete mathematics or the course MS-A01XX Differential and integral calculus 1 substitutes the course Mat-1.1110. Substitutes the courses MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

prerequisites.fi: MS-A00XX Matriisilaskenta, MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
prerequisites.sv: MS-A00XX Matrisräkning, MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
prerequisites.en: MS-A00XX Matrix algebra, MS-A01XX Differential- and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa laskea approksimaatioita osittaisderivaattojen avulla
- osaa ratkaista yhtälöryhmiä Newtonin menetelmällä
- tuntee ja ymmärtää optimoinnin perusideoita
- osaa käyttää Lagrangen kertoimia
- osaa laskea taso- ja avaruusintegraaleja
- osaa vaihtaa integroimisjärjestyksen tasointegraalissa
- osaa vaihtaa muuttujia taso- ja avaruusintegraalissa
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter att ha avklarat denna kurs skall studenten
- kunna räkna approximationer med hjälp av partiella derivator - kunna lösa ekvationssystem med Newtons metod - känna till och förstår optimeringens grundidéer - kunna använda Lagrange multiplikatorer - kunna räkna dubbel- och trippelintegraler - kunna byta integrationsordning i dubbelintegraler - kunna byta variabler i dubbel- och trippelintegraler
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will - know how to calculate approximations with the aid of partial derivatives - be able to solve systems of equations with Newton's method - know and understand the basic ideas of optimization - be able to use Lagrange multipliers - be able to calculate double and triple integrals - be able to change the order of integration in double integrals - know how to change variables in double and triple integrals

content.fi: usean muuttujan funktiot ja niiden derivaatat, usean muuttujan funktion optimointi, taso- ja avaruusintegraalit.
content.sv: funktioner av flera variabler och deras derivator, optimering av funktioner med flera variabler, dubbel- och trippelintegraler.
content.en: functions of several variables and their derivatives, optimization of functions with several variables, double and triple integrals.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

workload.fi: Kontaktiopetusta 52 h, itsenäistä työskentelyä 80 h.
workload.sv: Kontaktundervisning 52 h, sjävständig arbete 80 h.
workload.en: Contact teaching 52 h, self study 80 h.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Lukion pitkä matematiikka, lukion oppimäärän kurssi FY3, FY4, FY5, FY6 ja FY7 (LOPS 2003) tai FY3, FY4, FY5 ja FY6 (LOPS 2015) soveltuvin osin sekä Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1 tai vastaavat tiedot.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Gymnasiets långa matematik, gymnasiets fördjupande kurser i fysik FY3, FY4, FY5, FY6 och FY7 (GLP 2003) eller FY3, FY4, FY5 och FY6 (GLP 2015), samt Differential- och integralkalkyl 1 eller motsvarande kunskaper.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Extended mathematics curriculum in the Finnish upper secondary school, courses FY3, FY4, FY5, FY6 and FY7 (LOPS 2003) or FY3, FY4, FY5 and FY6 (LOPS 2015) from the Finnish upper secondary school when applicable and Differential and Integral Calculus 1 or equivalent.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
  1. suorittaa fysikaalisia mittauksia ja analysoida saamiaan tuloksia,
  2. laskea varausjakauman aiheuttaman sähkökentän ja potentiaalieron yksinkertaisissa geometrioissa,
  3. laskea sähkövirran aiheuttaman magneettikentän ja varattuun hiukkaseen tai virtajohtimeen kohdistuvan voiman magneettikentässä,
  4. määrittää induktiojännitteen sekä indusoituneen sähkökentän,
  5. määrittää virrat, jännitteet ja tehot vaihtovirtapiireissä,
  6. tunnistaa sähkömagneettisen säteilyn aaltoliikkeenä eteneviksi sähkö- ja magneettikentiksi.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs kan den studerande:
  1. utföra fysikaliska mätningar och analysera resultaten,
  2. bestämma elfältet och potentialen för enkla laddningsfördelningar,
  3. bestämma magnetfältet kring en elektrisk ström och kraften på en laddning och en strömledare i ett magnetfält,
  4. bestämma induktionsspänningen och inducerade elfält,
  5. bestämma strömmar, spänningar och effekter i växelströmskretsar,
  6. förstå sambandet mellan elektromagnetisk strålning och vågor av el- och magnetfält.
learningOutcomes.en:
After passing the course the student can
  1. perform physical measurements and analyze the results,
  2. calculate the electric field and potential for a charge distribution in a simple geometry,
  3. calculate the magnetic field caused by an electric current and the force acting on a charged particle and a current carrying wire in a magnetic field,
  4. determine the induced emf and the induced electric field,
  5. determine currents, potentials and powers in alternating-current circuits,
  6. recognize electromagnetic radiation as a propagating wave of electric and magnetic fields.

content.fi: Aina välttämätön aines: Tietäminen: Sähkökentän ja magneettikentän vektoriluonne, vuointegraalin ja viivaintegraalin käsitteet; Gaussin laki; Potentiaaliero; Sähkö- ja magneettikentän energia; Kapasitanssi; Eristeet ja permittiivisyys; Magneettinen voima ja Amperen laki; Faradayn induktiolaki, Lenzin laki ja induktanssi; Värähtelypiirit, pakkovärähtelijä, vaihe-ero ja resonanssi; Maxwellin yhtälöt, sähkömagneettinen aaltoliike ja intensiteetti. Soveltaminen: Symmetrisen varausjakauman sähkökenttä Gaussin lain avulla, potentiaaliero sähkökentän avulla; Magneettikenttä Amperen lain avulla, virtajohtimeen tai varaukseen kohdistuva voima(vektori) magneettikentässä; Johdinsilmukkaan indusoitunut jännite; Virta ja jännite kondensaattorille ja kelalle tasa- ja vaihtovirtapiirissä, resonanssitaajuus; Sähkö- ja magneettikenttien lausekkeet sähkömagneettiselle aallolle. Tarpeellinen ja täydentävä aines: Tietäminen: Superpositioperiaate sähkö- ja magneettikentälle; Sähkökentän ja magneettikentän energiatiheys; Sähkökenttä ja varauksen jakautuminen johteessa, tasapotentiaalipinnat; Biot-Savartin laki ja liikkuva varaus magneettikentän aiheuttajana; Indusoitunut sähkökenttä; Aikavakio ja tehokerroin; Kenttämuutosvirta; Sähkömagneettisen aaltoyhtälön johtaminen; Poyntingin vektori; Säteilypaine. Soveltaminen: Jatkuvan varausjakauman sähkökenttä, sähkökenttä potentiaalin avulla;  Magneettikenttä käyttäen Biot-Savartin lakia; Hetkellinen virta RC-ja RL-piirissä, teho vaihtovirtapiirissä.
content.sv: Alltid nödvändigt innehåll:  Kunskaper: Vektornaturen hos det elektriska och magnetiska fältet, flödesintegraler och linjeintegraler av fält; Gauss lag; Elektrisk potential; Energin i el- och magnetfält; Kapacitans; Isolatorer och permittivitet; Magnetisk kraft och Ampereslag; Faradays induktionslag och inducerade elektriska fält; Induktans; Oscillationskretsar, fasskillnad och resonans; Maxwells ekvationer, elektromagnetisk vågrörelse och intensitet. Tillämpning: Elfältet i och kring en symmetrisk laddningsfördelning med hjälp av Gauss lag, sambandet mellan potentialskillnad och elektriskt fält; Magnetfält med hjälp av Amperes lag, magnetisk kraft; Den inducerade spänningen i en strömslinga; Strömmen och spänningen för en kondensator och en spole i lik- och växelströmskretsar, resonans; El- och magnetfält för elektromagnetiska vågor. Nödvändigt och kompletterande innehåll: Kunskaper: Superpositionsprincipen för el- och magnetfält; Energidensiteten i el- och magnetfält; Elektriska fält och fördelningen av laddning i ledare, ekvipotentialytor; Biot-Savarts lag; Härledning av vågekvationen för elektromagnetiska vågor; Poynting vektorn; Strålningstryck. Tillämpning: Magnetfältet med hjälp av Biot-Savarts lag; Momentana strömmen i RC- och RL-kretsar, effekt i växelströmskretsar.
content.en: Always necessary material: Knowing: Vector nature of electric and magnetic field, flux and line integral; Gauss law; Potential difference; Energy of electric and magnetic field; Capacitance; Dielectrics and permittivity; Magnetic force and Ampere s law; Faraday s law of induction, Lenz s law and inductance; Oscillating circuits, forced oscillator, phase difference and resonance; Maxwell s equations, electromagnetic wave and intensity. Applying: Electric field of a symmetric charge distribution using Gauss law, potential difference using electric field; Magnetic field using Ampere s law, (vector) force acting on a current carrying wire or a charge in magnetic field; Induced emf in a current loop; Current and voltage for a capacitor and coil in DC and AC circuits, resonance frequency; Expressions of electric and magnetic field in electromagnetic wave. Complementary material: Knowing: Superposition principle for electric and magnetic field; Energy density of electric and magnetic field, Electric field and charge distribution in a conductor, equipotential surfaces; Biot-Savart law and moving charge as a source of magnetic field; Induced electric field; Time constant and power factor; Displacement current; Deriving electromagnetic wave equation; Poynting vector; Radiation pressure. Applying: Electric field for continuous charge distribution, electric field from potential; Magnetic field using Biot-Savart law; Momentary current in RC- and RL-circuits, power in AC circuit.

name.sv: Design of WWW Services D, Föreläsning
name.en: Design of WWW Services D, Lecture

workload.fi: Lectures 24 h (2 x 2 h/week, 12 times), group work 106 h (= 130 h in total).
workload.sv: Lectures 24 h (2 x 2 h/week, 12 times), group work 106 h (= 130 h in total).
workload.en: Lectures 24 h (2 x 2 h/week, 12 times), group work 106 h (= 130 h in total).

prerequisites.fi: Basic Web development skills.
prerequisites.sv: Basic Web development skills.
prerequisites.en: Basic Web development skills.

learningOutcomes.fi: During the course, you will go through the whole process of creating a finalized WWW service ready to be used by external users. You will gain an understanding of important aspects of WWW development, including service design (user categorization, functional design, information architecture, information security, graphic design, usability, etc.), service implementation (markup languages, Web programming languages and frameworks, databases, etc.), and content development (content production, copyrights, etc.). You will practice your skills while planning and implementing your service and documenting service development process in a sizable project work exercise. After the course, you will be able to develop a WWW service.
learningOutcomes.sv: During the course, you will go through the whole process of creating a finalized WWW service ready to be used by external users. You will gain an understanding of important aspects of WWW development, including service design (user categorization, functional design, information architecture, information security, graphic design, usability, etc.), service implementation (markup languages, Web programming languages and frameworks, databases, etc.), and content development (content production, copyrights, etc.). You will practice your skills while planning and implementing your service and documenting service development process in a sizable project work exercise. After the course, you will be able to develop a WWW service.
learningOutcomes.en: During the course, you will go through the whole process of creating a finalized WWW service ready to be used by external users. You will gain an understanding of important aspects of WWW development, including service design (user categorization, functional design, information architecture, information security, graphic design, usability, etc.), service implementation (markup languages, Web programming languages and frameworks, databases, etc.), and content development (content production, copyrights, etc.). You will practice your skills while planning and implementing your service and documenting service development process in a sizable project work exercise. After the course, you will be able to develop a WWW service.

content.fi: The course deals with designing and implementing WWW sites and interactive services on the Web. Guest lecturers from academia and industry cover relevant aspects, such as various Web service implementation techniques, usability, web service life span, graphic design, usability, and information security. The project work done in groups consists of designing and  implementing a WWW service and documenting the development process.

assesmentMethods.fi: The course teaching consists of lectures and project work done in groups. The grading is 100% based on the project work, which consists of three phases: design phase, demo phase, and final phase. Students receive points after each phase; final grade is given based on the total number of points.

name.en: Differential and Integral Calculus 1 (ELEC1, ENG1), Exam

prerequisites.fi: lukion matematiikka.
prerequisites.sv: gymnasiet matematik.
prerequisites.en: high school mathematics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa analysoida jonojen ja sarjojen suppenemista
- tuntee alkeisfunktioiden sarjakehitelmät ja approksimaatiot
- hallitsee tärkeimmät derivaatan ja integraalin ominaisuudet, laskumenetelmät ja sovellukset
- osaa ratkaista 1. kertaluvun lineaarisen ja separoituvan differentiaaliyhtälön
- osaa ratkaista 2. kertaluvun lineaarisen differentiaaliyhtälön vakiokertoimisessa tapauksessa
learningOutcomes.sv: - kunna analysera konvergens av talföljder och serier - känna till serieutvecklingar och approximationer av elementära funktioner - behärsk de viktigaste egenskaperna, räknemetoderna och tillämpningarna av derivatan och integralen - kunna lösa en separerbar differentialekvation av första ordningen - kunna lösa en linjär differentialekvation av andra ordningen med konstanta koefficienter
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will - be able to analyze the convergence of sequences and series - be familiar with the series expansions and approximations of elementary functions - master the most important properties, calculation methods, and applications of the derivative and the integral - be able to solve a first order differential equation in the linear and separable cases - be able to solve a linear second order differential equation in the case of constant coefficients

content.en: sequences, series, power series, derivatives and integrals, basic types of differential equations

prerequisites.fi: Programming skills (CS-A1110 or equivalent), data structures and algorithms (CS-A1140 or equivalent), basics of probability theory (MS-A050* or equivalent) and linear algebra.
prerequisites.sv: Programming skills (CS-A1110 or equivalent), data structures and algorithms (CS-A1140 or equivalent), basics of probability theory (MS-A050* or equivalent) and linear algebra.
prerequisites.en: Programming skills (CS-A1110 or equivalent), data structures and algorithms (CS-A1140 or equivalent), basics of probability theory (MS-A050* or equivalent) and linear algebra.

learningOutcomes.fi: Artificial intelligence (AI) tackles complex  real-world problems, such as question answering, speech recognition,  social network analysis, and task scheduling, with rigorous mathematical methods and tools. The goal of this course is to give an  in-depth introduction to AI methodology while approaching the topic  from the perspective of concrete application problems. Having  completed the course, you have gained a comprehensive overview of  AI and understand its fundamental principles related to machine  learning and logical reasoning. You have excellent premises for  solving real-world problems with modern AI techniques and building  intelligent systems by implementing such techniques.

Having  completed the course, you have gained a comprehensive overview of  AI and understand its fundamental principles related to machine  learning and logical reasoning. You have excellent premises for  solving real-world problems with modern AI techniques and building  intelligent systems by implementing such techniques.

Having  completed the course, you have gained a comprehensive overview of  AI and understand its fundamental principles related to machine  learning and logical reasoning. You have excellent premises for  solving real-world problems with modern AI techniques and building  intelligent systems by implementing such techniques.

literature.en: Electronic material made available at MyCourses.
literature.fi: Electronic material made available at MyCourses.
literature.sv: Electronic material made available at MyCourses.

content.fi: The course presents a range of central AI techniques and  provides the students with an extensive toolbox for solving problems  in practice. For applications that require high degree of adaptation,  specific techniques such as (deep) machine learning, reinforcement  learning, and graphical models are included. These methods are  instrumental for decision under uncertainty. For the purposes of  knowledge representation and reasoning, different logical  representations such as formulas and rules are covered. These representations establish the foundations for  declarative problem solving and enable the use of state-of-the-art solver technology to search for solutions. The course also encourages  the students to combine the logical and machine learning perspectives  when solving future problems.

The goal of this course is to give an  in-depth introduction to AI methodology while approaching the topic  from the perspective of concrete application problems. Having  completed the course, you have gained a comprehensive overview of  AI and understand its fundamental principles related to machine  learning and logical reasoning. You have excellent premises for  solving real-world problems with modern AI techniques and building  intelligent systems by implementing such techniques.

content.fi: The course presents a range of central AI techniques and  provides the students with an extensive toolbox for solving problems  in practice. For applications that require high degree of adaptation,  specific techniques such as (deep) machine learning, reinforcement  learning, and graphical models are included. These methods are  instrumental for decision under uncertainty. For the purposes of  knowledge representation and reasoning, different logical  representations such as formulas and rules are covered. These representations establish the foundations for  declarative problem solving and enable the use of state-of-the-art solver technology to search for solutions. The course also encourages  the students to combine the logical and machine learning perspectives  when solving future problems.

learningOutcomes.fi: The students has an overview of various applications of AI and of the fundamental problems, methods, and algorithms that underlie and that are necessary to build AI applications. The course gives the student a good basis for further study of the said methods and algorithms, with the main goal of 'demystifying' AI.

Jos et ole Aallon tutkinto-opiskelija, katsothan kurssin tarkat tiedot, hakuohjeet ja -ajat FITechin verkkosivuilta (fitech.io) alla olevan linkin kautta. ​Hakuaika: Hakuaika päättyy kaksi viikkoa ennen kurssin alkua.

If you are not a degree student of Aalto University, please check the detailed information and instructions to apply for the course on the Fitech website (fitech.io) at the link below. Application deadline: two weeks before the start of the course

content.fi: The course consists of lectures introducing applications of AI and the underlying computational problems as well as describing the principles of the methods and algorithms that are used to solve problems. The focus is on demystifying AI and giving the student an overview of the field. The course contains problem sets on the topics of the lectures. The content of the lectures may vary yearly.

prerequisites.fi: MS-A00XX Matrix algebra, MS-A01XX Differential- and integral calculus 1.
prerequisites.sv: MS-A00XX Matrix algebra, MS-A01XX Differential- and integral calculus 1.
prerequisites.en: MS-A00XX Matrix algebra, MS-A01XX Differential- and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will
- know how to calculate approximations with the aid of partial derivatives
- be able to solve systems of equations with Newton s method
- know and understand the basic ideas of optimization
- be able to use Lagrange multipliers
- be able to calculate double and triple integrals
- be able to change the order of integration in double integrals
- know how to change variables in double and triple integrals

- know how to change variables in double and triple integrals

- know how to change variables in double and triple integrals

content.fi: Functions of several variables and their derivatives, optimization of functions with several variables, double and triple integrals.

Together with the course MS-A04XX Foundations of discrete mathematics or the course MS-A01XX Differential and integral calculus 1 substitutes the course Mat-1.1110.
Substitutes the courses MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

- be able to solve systems of equations with Newton s method
- know and understand the basic ideas of optimization
- be able to use Lagrange multipliers
- be able to calculate double and triple integrals
- be able to change the order of integration in double integrals
- know how to change variables in double and triple integrals

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
- laskea moniulotteisia integraaleja niin karteesisessa kuin sylinteri- ja pallokoordinaatistossakin
- analysoida vektorikenttien ominaisuuksia
- laskea vektorikenttien polku- ja pintaintegraaleja
- laskea gradientin, divergenssin ja roottorin ja tietää, mitä nämä kuvaavat
- selittää Gaussin ja Stokesin lauseiden merkityksen ja käyttää niitä laskutehtävissä.
learningOutcomes.sv: - kunna beräkna flerdimensionella integraler i kartesiska, cylindriska och sfäriska koordinater, - kunna analysera egenskaper hos vektorfält, - kunna beräkna vektorfälts kurv- och ytintegraler, - kunna beräkna gradienten, divergensen och rotationen och vet vad de beskriver, - kunna förklara innebörden av Gauss' och Stokes' sats och tillämpa dessa i beräkningar.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will be able to - evaluate multiple integrals in cartesian, cylindrical and spherical coordinates, - analyze the properties of vector fields, - evaluate line and surface integrals of vector fields, - calculate the gradient, divergence and curl, and knows what they represent, - explain the idea of Gauss' and Stokes' theorems, and apply them in calculations.

content.fi: muuttujanvaihto moniulotteisissa integraaleissa, integrointi sylinteri- ja pallokoordinaatistoissa, vektorikentät, polku- ja pintaintegraalit, gradientti, divergenssi, roottori, Gaussin, Greenin ja Stokesin lauseet.
content.sv: variabelbyte i flerdimensionella integraler, integrering i cylindriska och sfäriska koordinater, vektorfält, kurv- och ytintegraler, gradient, divergens, rotation, Gauss', Greens och Stokes' satser.
content.en: change of variables in multiple integrals, integration in cylindrical and spherical coordinates, vector fields, line and surface integrals, gradient, divergence, curl, Gauss's, Green's and Stokes' theorems.

substitutes.fi: Yhdessä kurssin MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2 kanssa korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat- 1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A03XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 3.
substitutes.sv: Tillsammans med kursen MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2 ersätter kurser Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat- 1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A03XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 3.
substitutes.en: Together with the course MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2 substitutes the courses Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Substitutes the courses MS-A03XX Differential and integral calculus 3.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
- laskea moniulotteisia integraaleja niin karteesisessa kuin sylinteri- ja pallokoordinaatistossakin
- analysoida vektorikenttien ominaisuuksia
- laskea vektorikenttien polku- ja pintaintegraaleja
- laskea gradientin, divergenssin ja roottorin ja tietää, mitä nämä kuvaavat
- selittää Gaussin ja Stokesin lauseiden merkityksen ja käyttää niitä laskutehtävissä.
learningOutcomes.sv: - kunna beräkna flerdimensionella integraler i kartesiska, cylindriska och sfäriska koordinater, - kunna analysera egenskaper hos vektorfält, - kunna beräkna vektorfälts kurv- och ytintegraler, - kunna beräkna gradienten, divergensen och rotationen och vet vad de beskriver, - kunna förklara innebörden av Gauss' och Stokes' sats och tillämpa dessa i beräkningar.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will be able to - evaluate multiple integrals in cartesian, cylindrical and spherical coordinates, - analyze the properties of vector fields, - evaluate line and surface integrals of vector fields, - calculate the gradient, divergence and curl, and knows what they represent, - explain the idea of Gauss' and Stokes' theorems, and apply them in calculations.

content.fi: muuttujanvaihto moniulotteisissa integraaleissa, integrointi sylinteri- ja pallokoordinaatistoissa, vektorikentät, polku- ja pintaintegraalit, gradientti, divergenssi, roottori, Gaussin, Greenin ja Stokesin lauseet.
content.sv: variabelbyte i flerdimensionella integraler, integrering i cylindriska och sfäriska koordinater, vektorfält, kurv- och ytintegraler, gradient, divergens, rotation, Gauss', Greens och Stokes' satser.
content.en: change of variables in multiple integrals, integration in cylindrical and spherical coordinates, vector fields, line and surface integrals, gradient, divergence, curl, Gauss's, Green's and Stokes' theorems.

workload.fi: 21 t lähiopetus, harjoitustyöt ja ryhmätyö.
workload.sv: Kontaktundervisning 21 h, övningsarbeten och grupparbete
workload.en: 21h contact teaching, exercises, team report.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija tunnistaa ja osaa nimetä tulevaisuudentutkimuksen keskeiset toimijat, alan keskeiset kansalliset ja kansainväliset yhteisöt sekä osaa hyödyntää näiden tuottamaa materiaalia opintojaksolla tehtävässä tulevaisuustyöskentelyssä. Hän ymmärtää tulevaisuustiedon monitieteisen ja systeemisen luonteen sekä sen, kuinka tällaista tietoa voidaan tuottaa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter att ha genomfört kursen kan studerande känna igen och namnge de centrala aktörerna inom framtidsforskning, områdets nationella och internationella samfund, samt dra nytta av deras material i framtidsarbetet som görs på kursen. Studerande förstår framtidsinformationens mångvetenskapliga och systematiska karaktär samt hur sådan här information kan framställas.
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, the student knows central actors in the field of futures studies, is able to name key national and international societies in this field and can benefit from the materials produced by these in carrying out futures work. The student understands what the multidisciplinary and systemic nature of futures knowledge means and how such knowledge can be produced.

content.fi: Kurssilla tehdään pienryhmissä harjoitustyönä skenaarioraportti, jonka teeman pienryhmä saa itse päättää. Pienryhmä opponoi toisten ryhmän skenaarioraporttia. Harjoitustyön hyväksytysti suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa soveltaa skenaarioajattelua ja tulevaisuustaulukkomenetelmää vaihtoehtoisten tulevaisuuksien kuvaamiseen ja pystyy arvioimaan kehitystrendejä.
content.sv: I kursen utför mindre grupper av studerande ett övningsarbete genom att producera en scenariorapport vars tema bestäms av gruppen själv. Varje grupp fungerar som opponent för en scenariorapport skriven av en annan grupp. Efter godkänt övningsarbete kan studeranden tillämpa scenariotänkande och framtidskalkylmetoden för att beskriva alternativa framtider och utvärdera utvecklingstrender.
content.en: In the course small student teams will carry out independent exercises by producing scenario reports on topics that they have selected. Each team will serve as the opponent for a report produced by another team. After the approval of the exercise, the student is able to apply scenario thinking and construct futures tables in order to describe alternative futures and to evaluate future trends.

assesmentMethods.fi: Lähiopetus, ryhmätyöskentely, itsenäinen työskentely, harjoitukset ja verkkokeskustelut  Aktiivinen osallistuminen lähiopetukseen, verkko-opetukseen, viikkoharjoituksiin ja harjoitustyöhön pienryhmissä (15-20 sivun ryhmäraportti).
assesmentMethods.sv: Kontaktundervisning, grupparbete, självständigt arbete, övningar och nätdiskussioner.Aktivt deltagande i kontaktundervisningen, nätundervisningen, veckoövningarna och övningsarbetet i smågrupper (15-20 sidors grupprapport).
assesmentMethods.en: Contact teaching, team working, independent study, exercises and participation in web-based discussions.Active participation in contact teaching, web-based teaching, weekly exercise sessions, preparation of team reports (15-20 pages written sivun by a team).

workload.sv: Självständigt arbete och tentamen
workload.en: Independent work and exam.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija tuntee ihmisen keskeiset fysiologiset mekanismit sekä niiden toimintaperiaatteet ja tutkimusmenetelmät.
learningOutcomes.sv: Kursens syfte är att ge studenten grundläggande kunskaper om människans fysiologiska functionsprinciper, mekanismer och forskningsmetoder.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student understands the core physiological mechanisms of the human body, their functional principles, and the related research methods.

content.fi: Ihmisen fysiologisten mekanismien perusteet solu-, kudos- ja järjestelmätasolla. Biosähköisten ilmiöiden fysiologiaa, liikemekanismit, hermosto ja aistimekanismit, biologiset säätö- ja ylläpitojärjestelmät. Keskeiset fysiologiset tutkimusmenetelmät.
content.sv: Grundkunskaperna av människans fysiologi, dess mekanismer från cellfunktioner och vävnader till systemnivå. Bioelektriska fenomen, rörelsemekanismer, nervsystem och sinnen, biologiska regler- och underhållssystem. Forskningsmetoder i fysiologi.
content.en: The basics of the physiological mechanisms of humans at cellular, tissue, and systems levels. The physiology of bioelectrical phenomena, mechanisms of motion, the nervous system and senses, biological mechanisms of regulation and homeostasis. The essential methods to study human physiology.

learningOutcomes.fi: Miten elää hyvä elämä? Kurssin tavoitteena on vahvistaa osallistujan valmiuksia ymmärtää hyvän elämän peruskysymyksiä ja tehdä perusteltuja valintoja elämässään. Kurssi antaa työkaluja pohtia mitä omassa elämässään kannattaa tavoitella, auttaa tunnistamaan keskeisiä hyvän elämän esteitä sekä haasteita ja kertoo mitkä elämänvalinnat tuottavat tutkitusti hyvinvointia, onnellisuutta ja merkityksellisyyttä. Pyrkimyksenä on syventää ymmärrystä itsestä, ihmisyydestä ja elämästä sekä vahvistaa valmiuksia elää omaehtoista ja itse hyväksi koettua elämää.
learningOutcomes.sv: Vad är ett gott liv? Kursens syfte är att stärka deltagarens förmåga att förstå grundfrågor om ett gott liv och att göra välgrundade val i sitt liv. Kursen ger verktyg för att reflektera över vad det är värt att sträva efter i sitt eget liv, hjälper att identifiera centrala hinder och utmaningar för ett gott liv och berättar om hurdana livsval som enligt forskning skapar välmående, lycka och meningsfullhet. Syftet är att fördjupa förståelsen av sig själv, mänskligheten och livet samt stärka färdigheter att leva ett liv som man själv har valt och upplever som gott.
learningOutcomes.en: How to live a good life? The aim of this course is to strengthen the participant’s understanding of the fundamental questions of good life and how to make reasoned life choices. The course gives tools to think about what to aim for in life, helps to identify barriers and challenges to good life, and explains what latest research tells about the choices in life that tend to lead to well-being, happiness, and meaningfulness. The purpose is to deepen the participant’s understanding of oneself, life, and what being a human entails, while strengthening the ability to live a life that is volitional, self-chosen and good according to one’s own standards.

content.fi: Kurssin luennoilla ja harjoituksissa pureudutaan motivaatioon, onnellisuuteen, jaksamiseen, merkityksellisyyteen, tavoitteiden asettamiseen ja elämänvalintoihin liittyviin kysymyksiin ammentaen sekä tuoreesta psykologisesta tutkimuksesta että tuhatvuotisesta filosofisesta perinteestä. Ymmärryksen lisäämisen ohella tärkeässä roolissa ovat erilaiset tehtävät, harjoitukset ja ryhmäkeskustelut, jotka auttavat ankkuroimaan käsiteltävät kysymykset opiskelijan omaan arkeen, työelämään ja tuleviin elämänvalintoihin.
content.sv: På föreläsningarna och i övningarna fördjupar man sig i motivation, lycka, ork, meningsfullhet, målsättning och frågor som handlar om livsval. Kunskap tas från såväl aktuell psykologisk forskning som tusenårig filosofisk tradition. Vid sidan av att öka förståelsen spelar olika uppgifter, övningar, och gruppdiskussioner en viktig roll i att förankra frågorna som behandlas i studerandens vardag, arbetsliv och kommande livsval.
content.en: The lectures and exercises will focus on questions related to motivation, happiness, coping, meaningfulness, goal-setting, and making life choices building on both the latest psychological research as well as the long-standing philosophical tradition. In addition to increasing the participant’s understanding of the topics in question, the course will rely much on various exercises, group discussions, and other methods that will anchor the topics to the participant’s own everyday life, working life, and future life choices.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssisuoritus perustuu luennoille ja ryhmäkokoontumisiin osallistumiseen sekä tehtävien tekemiseen. Tarkemmat tiedot MyCoursesissa.
assesmentMethods.sv: Bedömningen baserar sig på föreläsningar, gruppträffar och gruppuppgifter.
assesmentMethods.en: Course accomplishment will be based on participation in lectures and group gatherings as well as doing the exercises. More detailed information in MyCourses.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: TU-A1100 Tuotantotalous 1 (5 op)
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: TU-A1200 Grundkurs i produktionsekonomi (5 sp)
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: TU-A1100 Industrial Engineering and Management 1 (5 cr)

learningOutcomes.fi: Ymmärtää tuotantojärjestelmien suunnittelua ja toimintaa kuvaava käsitteistö ja viitekehykset sekä strategisella että operatiivisella tasolla. Käsittää operaatioiden johtaminen sekä organisaation sisäisenä että organisaatioiden välisenä toimintana globaalilla tasolla. Tavoitteena on käsitteistön ja teorian hallinnan lisäksi soveltaa opittua käytäntöön harjoitustyössä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Att förstå planering av produktionssystemen och begreppen beskrivande verksamhet samt referensramarna både på en strategisk och operativ nivå. Uppfatta ledning av operationer som både en intern verksamhet och en verksamhet mellan organisationer på en global nivå. Målet är utöver behärskning av begreppen och teorin att genom övningsarbeten lära sig tillämpa de inlärda kunskaperna i praktiken.
learningOutcomes.en: To develop understanding of concepts and theoretical frameworks that describe, explain and prescribe the design and operation of production systems from strategy to daily operations. Operations management is perceived to cover both intra- and inter-organizational aspects in a global context. Besides providing relevant operations management concepts and theories, the objective is to learn to apply practical application of this knowledge through case studies and other assignments.

content.fi: Operaatiostrategia, palveluoperaatiot, prosessien suunnittelu ja kehittäminen, prosessityypin valinnat ja layout-suunnittelu, kapasiteetin ja materiaalivirtojen hallinta, globaalit toiminnot, logistiikka ja toimitusketjun hallinta, laatujohtaminen.
content.sv: Operationsstrategi, serviceoperationer, planering och utveckling av processer, val av processtyp och layout-planering, behärskning av kapacitet och materialflöden, globala verksamheter, logistik och behärskning av leveranskedjan, kvalitetsledning.
content.en: Operations strategy, service operations, process design and improvement, process choices and production layout, capacity and materials management, global operations, logistics and supply chain management, quality management.

name.fi: Introduction to plasma physics for fusion and space applications D, Tentti
name.sv: Introduction to plasma physics for fusion and space applications D, Tentamen
name.en: Introduction to plasma physics for fusion and space applications D, Exam

workload.fi: Contact teaching, independent work (exercises, mini-assignments), exam
workload.sv: Contact teaching, independent work (exercises, mini-assignments), exam
workload.en: Contact teaching, independent work (exercises, mini-assignments), exam

prerequisites.fi: Basic knowledge (at the level of a 3rd year student) in statistical physics and electromagnetism.
prerequisites.sv: Basic knowledge (at the level of a 3rd year student) in statistical physics and electromagnetism.
prerequisites.en: Basic knowledge (at the level of a 3rd year student) in statistical physics and electromagnetism.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course the students should have a basic understanding of plasma phenomenology, so that they can explain, e.g., how the radio waves propagate in the earth's atmosphere, and how a fusion plasma with a temperature of 100 million degrees can be controlled in laboratory conditions.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course the students should have a basic understanding of plasma phenomenology, so that they can explain, e.g., how the radio waves propagate in the earth's atmosphere, and how a fusion plasma with a temperature of 100 million degrees can be controlled in laboratory conditions.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the students should have a basic understanding of plasma phenomenology, so that they can explain, e.g., how the radio waves propagate in the earth's atmosphere, and how a fusion plasma with a temperature of 100 million degrees can be controlled in laboratory conditions.

content.fi: Plasma is the fourth and most common state of matter in our cosmos. Our direct contacts with plasma are still -- fortunately -- few and far apart. However, since e.g., modern tele communication is based on basic properties of plasmas, and fusion energy could help slow down the climate change, learning some basics of this peculiar state of matter is not only interesting but also useful.In this course the student will be introduced to plasma, a gas consisting of electrically charged particles, which makes its properties dramatically different from those of the more familiar states of matter: the free charges interact via Coulomb force that has, in principle, infinite range. This allows plasma to display a host of interesting collective phenomena, the most useful and intriguing of which  will be introduced in this course. The plasma will be treated predominantly with the magnetohydrodynamic description, the foundations of which will be outlined.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: TU-A1100 Tuotantotalous TAI TU-A1200 Grundkurs i Produktionsekonomi TAI TU-A1300 Introduction to Industrial Engineering and Management

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelijat:
  • Tuntevat projektinhallinnan perusmenetelmät ja -käsitteet, sekä osaavat soveltaa niitä yksinkertaisessa projektiympäristössä
  • Osaavat tunnistaa ja arvioida yksittäiseen projektiin ja sen johtamiseen vaikuttavia tekijöitä
  • Tunnistavat projektien ja projektiportfolioiden yhteydet yrityksen strategiseen johtamiseen

organizationName.en: Department of Industrial Engineering and Management

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
- laskea moniulotteisia integraaleja niin karteesisessa kuin sylinteri- ja pallokoordinaatistossakin
- analysoida vektorikenttien ominaisuuksia
- laskea vektorikenttien polku- ja pintaintegraaleja
- laskea gradientin, divergenssin ja roottorin ja tietää, mitä nämä kuvaavat
- selittää Gaussin ja Stokesin lauseiden merkityksen ja käyttää niitä laskutehtävissä.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter att ha avklarat denna kurs skall studenten
- kunna beräkna flerdimensionella integraler i kartesiska, cylindriska och sfäriska koordinater, - kunna analysera egenskaper hos vektorfält, - kunna beräkna vektorfälts kurv- och ytintegraler, - kunna beräkna gradienten, divergensen och rotationen och vet vad de beskriver, - kunna förklara innebörden av Gauss' och Stokes' sats och tillämpa dessa i beräkningar.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student will be able to - evaluate multiple integrals in cartesian, cylindrical and spherical coordinates, - analyze the properties of vector fields, - evaluate line and surface integrals of vector fields, - calculate the gradient, divergence and curl, and knows what they represent, - explain the idea of Gauss' and Stokes' theorems, and apply them in calculations.

content.fi: muuttujanvaihto moniulotteisissa integraaleissa, integrointi sylinteri- ja pallokoordinaatistoissa, vektorikentät, polku- ja pintaintegraalit, gradientti, divergenssi, roottori, Gaussin, Greenin ja Stokesin lauseet.
content.sv: variabelbyte i flerdimensionella integraler, integrering i cylindriska och sfäriska koordinater, vektorfält, kurv- och ytintegraler, gradient, divergens, rotation, Gauss', Greens och Stokes' satser.
content.en: change of variables in multiple integrals, integration in cylindrical and spherical coordinates, vector fields, line and surface integrals, gradient, divergence, curl, Gauss's, Green's and Stokes' theorems.

substitutes.fi: Yhdessä kurssin MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2 kanssa korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A03XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 3.
substitutes.sv: Tillsammans med kursen MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2 ersätter kurser Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A03XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 3.
substitutes.en: Together with the course MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2 substitutes the courses Mat-1.1020, Mat-1.1220, Mat-1.1320, Mat-1.1420, Mat-1.1520, Mat-1.1620, Mat-1.1720. Substitutes the courses MS-A03XX Differential and integral calculus 3.

additionalInformation.en: Teaching Language: Swedish Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Spring IV  2025-2026 Spring IV

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student
- understands the concept of proof and its necessity
- knows the basics of sets, functions, and relations
- has adopted the central mathematical notations
- masters the elements of combinatorics, the integers, modular arithmetic, and graph theory
- knows how to manipulate permutation groups

name.fi: First Course in Probability and Statistics, Tentti
name.sv: First Course in Probability and Statistics, Tentamen
name.en: First Course in Probability and Statistics, Exam

prerequisites.fi: University level mathematics course, for example MS-A000X Matrix algebra or MS-A010X Differential and integral calculus 1.
prerequisites.sv: University level mathematics course, for example MS-A000X Matrix algebra or MS-A010X Differential and integral calculus 1.
prerequisites.en: University level mathematics course, for example MS-A000X Matrix algebra or MS-A010X Differential and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After course the student
- can compute probabilities of composite events by applying operations of set theory
- is familiar with the most important discrete and continuous probability distributions and recognizes situations that can modeled with them
- can apply joint distributions to compute statistics of random vectors and to recognize when two random variables are stochastically independent
- knows methods for estimating the parameters of a statistical model
- can compute posterior distributions and make conclusions based on them
- can explain what can and what cannot be concluded from a p-value of chosen statistical test
learningOutcomes.sv: After course the student- can compute probabilities of composite events by applying operations of set theory- is familiar with the most important discrete and continuous probability distributions and recognizes situations that can modeled with them- can apply joint distributions to compute statistics of random vectors and to recognize when two random variables are stochastically independent- knows methods for estimating the parameters of a statistical model- can compute posterior distributions and make conclusions based on them- can explain what can and what cannot be concluded from a p-value of chosen statistical test
learningOutcomes.en: After course the student- can compute probabilities of composite events by applying operations of set theory- is familiar with the most important discrete and continuous probability distributions and recognizes situations that can modeled with them- can apply joint distributions to compute statistics of random vectors and to recognize when two random variables are stochastically independent- knows methods for estimating the parameters of a statistical model- can compute posterior distributions and make conclusions based on them- can explain what can and what cannot be concluded from a p-value of chosen statistical test

content.fi: - the notion of probability and its basic arithmetic rules- the most important discrete and continuous distributions- expectation, sample mean, and the law of large numbers- variance, sample variances, and normal approximation- stochastic dependence and correlation- description of data using statistics and histograms- parameter estimation of statistical models- the concept of a confidence interval- prior distribution, likelihood function, and posterior distribution- testing of simple statistical hypotheses
content.sv: - the notion of probability and its basic arithmetic rules- the most important discrete and continuous distributions- expectation, sample mean, and the law of large numbers- variance, sample variances, and normal approximation- stochastic dependence and correlation- description of data using statistics and histograms- parameter estimation of statistical models- the concept of a confidence interval- prior distribution, likelihood function, and posterior distribution- testing of simple statistical hypotheses
content.en: - the notion of probability and its basic arithmetic rules- the most important discrete and continuous distributions- expectation, sample mean, and the law of large numbers- variance, sample variances, and normal approximation- stochastic dependence and correlation- description of data using statistics and histograms- parameter estimation of statistical models- the concept of a confidence interval- prior distribution, likelihood function, and posterior distribution- testing of simple statistical hypotheses

prerequisites.fi: The student should be familiar with basic proof techniques, sets, functions, and relations, especially modular arithmetic and the congruence relation. These are covered on the course MS-A04XX Foundations of discrete mathematics, and typically in any standard book on abstract algebra. Finnish-speaking students can also looks at the lecture notes: Metsänkylä-Näätänen, Algebra, sections 0, I, II, matematiikkalehtisolmu.fi/2010/algebra.pdf).

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student knows - methods of rigorous reasoning in mathematical analysis - basic topology of inner product spaces, normed spaces, and metric spaces
- the notions of limit and continuity
- the definitions and fundamental properties of compactness, completeness, and connectedness in metric spaces.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After passing the course the student knows
- methods of rigorous reasoning in mathematical analysis
- basic topology of inner product spaces, normed spaces, and metric spaces- the notions of limit and continuity- the definitions and fundamental properties of compactness, completeness, and connectedness in metric spaces.
learningOutcomes.en:
After passing the course the student knows
- methods of rigorous reasoning in mathematical analysis
- basic topology of inner product spaces, normed spaces, and metric spaces- the notions of limit and continuity- the definitions and fundamental properties of compactness, completeness, and connectedness in metric spaces.

prerequisites.fi: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A00XX Matrix algebra
prerequisites.sv: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A00XX Matrix algebra
prerequisites.en: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A00XX Matrix algebra

learningOutcomes.fi: After passing the course the students can conduct simple statistical analyses. They know how to calculate summary statistics and how to properly visualize data. Students are able to select suitable summary statistics and parameter estimates for different types of data sets and construct bootstrap confidence intervals for the estimated parameters. Students are able to select suitable statistical tests for different testing settings. They know how to apply different t-tests, chi-square tests and nonparametric tests and understand the general statistical assumptions that are required for applying these tests. Students are able to detect different types of dependencies between variables and they are familiar with univariate and multivariate linear regression analysis. They can conduct linear regression analysis in practice and they understand the underlying model assumptions.
learningOutcomes.sv: After passing the course the students can conduct simple statistical analyses. They know how to calculate summary statistics and how to properly visualize data. Students are able to select suitable summary statistics and parameter estimates for different types of data sets and construct bootstrap confidence intervals for the estimated parameters. Students are able to select suitable statistical tests for different testing settings. They know how to apply different t-tests, chi-square tests and nonparametric tests and understand the general statistical assumptions that are required for applying these tests. Students are able to detect different types of dependencies between variables and they are familiar with univariate and multivariate linear regression analysis. They can conduct linear regression analysis in practice and they understand the underlying model assumptions.
learningOutcomes.en: After passing the course the students can conduct simple statistical analyses. They know how to calculate summary statistics and how to properly visualize data. Students are able to select suitable summary statistics and parameter estimates for different types of data sets and construct bootstrap confidence intervals for the estimated parameters. Students are able to select suitable statistical tests for different testing settings. They know how to apply different t-tests, chi-square tests and nonparametric tests and understand the general statistical assumptions that are required for applying these tests. Students are able to detect different types of dependencies between variables and they are familiar with univariate and multivariate linear regression analysis. They can conduct linear regression analysis in practice and they understand the underlying model assumptions.

content.fi: The course is an introduction to statistical analysis and statistical inference. Course topics include estimation, simple parametric and nonparametric tests, statistical dependence and correlation, linear regression analysis and analysis of variance. Software R is used in this course.
content.sv: The course is an introduction to statistical analysis and statistical inference. Course topics include estimation, simple parametric and nonparametric tests, statistical dependence and correlation, linear regression analysis and analysis of variance. Software R is used in this course.
content.en: The course is an introduction to statistical analysis and statistical inference. Course topics include estimation, simple parametric and nonparametric tests, statistical dependence and correlation, linear regression analysis and analysis of variance. Software R is used in this course.
